publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-6441 Sandra White: Tragic Deaths Aboard Humanitarian Convoy—That the Parliament condemns in the strongest possible terms the attack by the Israeli navy on the freedom flotilla, a convoy of boats with over 600 passengers including 28 Britons and 10 MEPs carrying humanitarian aid to Gaza in an attempt to break what is widely considered the illegal blockade of Gaza, which has led to a number of deaths;considers that the attack occurred in international waters in clear contravention of international maritime law; believes that, regardless of viewpoints on the Israeli-Palestinian situation, such actions perpetrated against the international community and in clear defiance of international law are indefensible, and calls on the UK Government and the European Union to take appropriate actions including the consideration of sanctions. Supported by: Alasdair Allan*, Pauline McNeill*, Robin Harper*, Gil Paterson*, Mike Pringle*, Michael Matheson*, Christine Grahame*, Aileen Campbell*, Bob Doris*, Bill Butler*, Rob Gibson*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Stuart McMillan*, Bill Wilson*, Christina McKelvie*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Bill Kidd*, Anne McLaughlin*, John Wilson*
S3M-6441 Tragic Deaths Aboard Humanitarian Convoy (lodged on 1 June 2010) Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Jamie Hepburn*, Jim Hume*, Angela Constance*, Elaine Smith*, Patricia Ferguson*, Tricia Marwick*
S3M-6441 Tragic Deaths Aboard Humanitarian Convoy (lodged on 1 June 2010) Trish Godman*, Jackie Baillie*, Cathy Peattie*

S3M-6441 Sandra White: Tragic Deaths Aboard Humanitarian Convoy—That the Parliament condemns in the strongest possible terms the attack by the Israeli navy on the freedom flotilla, a convoy of boats with over 600 passengers including 28 Britons and 10 MEPs carrying humanitarian aid to Gaza in an attempt to break what is widely considered the illegal blockade of Gaza, which has led to a number of deaths;considers that the attack occurred in international waters in clear contravention of international maritime law; believes that, regardless of viewpoints on the Israeli-Palestinian situation, such actions perpetrated against the international community and in clear defiance of international law are indefensible, and calls on the UK Government and the European Union to take appropriate actions including the consideration of sanctions. Supported by: Alasdair Allan, Pauline McNeill, Robin Harper, Gil Paterson, Mike Pringle, Michael Matheson, Christine Grahame, Aileen Campbell, Bob Doris, Bill Butler, Rob Gibson, Joe FitzPatrick, Stuart McMillan, Bill Wilson, Christina McKelvie, Hugh O’Donnell, Bill Kidd, Anne McLaughlin, John Wilson, Shirley-Anne Somerville, Jamie Hepburn, Jim Hume, Angela Constance, Elaine Smith, Patricia Ferguson, Tricia Marwick, Trish Godman, Jackie Baillie, Cathy Peattie
S3M-6441 Tragic Deaths Aboard Humanitarian Convoy (lodged on 1 June 2010) Linda Fabiani*
